briefdescription.para: Stores the finite mps state and components to operate on it, such as environments and model mpo's.

detaileddescription.para: The finite state mps is always partitioned into two lists, corresponding to the two sides left and right of the current position. Each site contains a "Vidal" site, i.e., a bond matrix $ \Lambda $ and an mps tensor $\Gamma $ in Vidal's notation. In the left side the sites are left normalized, with the bond matrix on the left $ \Lambda \Gamma \ = A$. In the right side the sites are right normalized, with the bond matrix on the right $ \Gamma \Lambda = B$. At the center is the center bond matrix MPS_C, a.k.a. $ \Lambda^C $.
